abstract.text: A container that stores a sequence of GPU commands that you encode into it.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: A command buffer represents a chunk of work for the GPU that stores the commands you encode to it, as well as any resources those commands need. You primarily use a command buffer to:
Create command encoders and call their methods to add commands to the buffer
Optionally reserve a place for the command buffer in its command queue by
enqueuing
the command buffer, even before you encode any commands into it
Submit, or commit_,_ the contents of the command buffer to the command queue that creates it to run on the GPU device the queue represents
Create a command encoder from an
instance by calling its
method. Typically, you create one or more command queues when your app launches and then keep them throughout your app’s lifetime.
To add commands to an
instance, create an encoder from one of its factory methods, including:
An
instance by calling
An
instance by calling
An
instance by calling
or
An
instance by calling
All encoders inherit additional methods from the
You can use only a single encoder at a time to add commands to a command buffer. To start using a different command encoder, first signal that you’re done with the current encoder by calling its
method. Then create another command encoder from the command buffer and continue adding commands to the buffer with the new encoder.

Repeat the process until you finish encoding commands to the command buffer and are ready to run the buffer’s contents on the GPU. Then submit the command buffer to the command queue that you used to create it by calling the command buffer’s
method. After an app commits a command buffer, you check its
property or block a thread by calling its
or
methods.
You also have the option to reserve a place for the command buffer in its command queue by calling the command buffer’s

method. You can call this method exactly once at any time before you commit the buffer to the queue. If you don’t enqueue a command buffer, it implicitly enqueues itself when you commit it. Each command queue ensures the order that you enqueue its command buffers is the same order the queue schedules them to run on the GPU.
Establish an order of execution for multiple command buffers you encode in parallel by first calling their
methods in that order.
For example, a multithreaded app might set the GPU’s execution order for a sequence of related subtasks by:
Creating a command buffer for each subtask
Enqueuing the command buffers in the proper order on a single thread
Encoding commands to each buffer on a separate thread and then committing it

abstract.text: Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
An interface you can use to encode GPU commands that copy and modify the underlying memory of various Metal resources.
A container that stores a sequence of GPU commands that you encode into it.
Registers a completion handler the GPU device calls immediately after the GPU finishes running the commands in the command buffer.
Registers a completion handler the GPU device calls immediately after it schedules the command buffer to run on the GPU.
Submits the command buffer to run on the GPU.
Encodes a command that updates an event’s value, which can clear the GPU to run passes from other command buffers waiting for the event.
Encodes a command into the command buffer that pauses the GPU from running the buffer’s subsequent passes until the event equals or exceeds a value.
Reserves the next available place for the command buffer in its command queue.
Creates a block information transfer (blit) encoder.
Creates a block information transfer (blit) encoder from a descriptor.
Creates a compute command encoder with a dispatch type.
Creates a parallel render command encoder from a descriptor.
Creates a render command encoder from a descriptor.
Presents a drawable as early as possible.
Presents a drawable after the system presents the previous drawable for an amount of time.
Presents a drawable at a specific time.
The command buffer’s current state.
Attaches a residency set to the command buffer.
Attaches multiple residency sets to the command buffer.
Attaches multiple residency sets to the command buffer.
Blocks the current thread until the GPU finishes executing the command buffer and all of its completion handlers.
Blocks the current thread until the command queue schedules the buffer.
A configuration that customizes the behavior for a new command buffer.
The command buffer error codes that indicate why the GPU doesn’t finish executing a command buffer.
Error codes that indicate why a GPU is unable to finish running a command buffer.
The domain for Metal command buffer errors.
A completion handler signature a GPU device calls when it finishes scheduling a command buffer, or when the GPU finishes running it.
The discrete states for a command buffer that represent its life cycle stages.
An encoder that writes GPU commands into a command buffer.
Declares that all command generation from the encoder is completed.
An instance you use to create, submit, and schedule command buffers to a specific GPU device to run the commands within those buffers.
Returns a command buffer from the command queue that maintains strong references to resources.
A configuration that customizes the behavior for a new command queue.
An interface for dispatching commands to encode in a compute pass.
An object that splits up a single render pass so that it can be simultaneously encoded from multiple threads.
An interface that encodes a render pass into a command buffer, including all its draw calls and configuration.
Properties and methods for programmatically debugging runtime issues with a command buffer.
A command encoder defines the actions of a single pass, such as GPU commands that draw, compute, or quickly copy resource data.
Discover how Metal executes commands on a GPU.
Organize your resources into groups and influence when they become accessible to the GPU.

doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Meta.title: Simplifying GPU Resource Management with Residency Sets

abstract.text: Optimize resource performance within an argument buffer.

doc://com.apple.metal/documentation/Meta.title: Tracking the Resource Residency of Argument Buffers

abstract.text: The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
Create a command encoder from a command buffer that encodes a series of GPU commands to it.
Instruct the GPU to wait for an event between two passes until a different command queue’s command buffer signals the event.
Instruct the command buffer to call a drawable’s presentation method for you at the best time with convenience methods.
Notify your app before and after a command buffer runs on the GPU.
Send a command buffer to run on the GPU, or reserve a place in the queue to arrange its relative order with other command buffers.
Pause your app’s execution on the CPU until the command buffer changes its state.
Create a command encoder from a command buffer that encodes a series of GPU commands to it.
Instruct the GPU to wait for an event between two passes until a different command queue’s command buffer signals the event.
Instruct the command buffer to call a drawable’s presentation method for you at the best time with convenience methods.
Notify your app before and after a command buffer runs on the GPU.
Send a command buffer to run on the GPU, or reserve a place in the queue to arrange its relative order with other command buffers.
Pause your app’s execution on the CPU until the command buffer changes its state.
